content:
That's a great plan!

Researching the market and understanding the average salary range for a Senior Marketing Manager in the New York office will give you a solid foundation for your salary negotiation. Additionally, reaching out to colleagues and peers will provide you with valuable insights and help you get a better sense of the market.

Remember to also consider factors such as:

* Your skills and experience: How do they align with the job requirements and industry standards?
* The company's budget: What is the company's budget for the role, and how does it compare to industry standards?
* Your goals and expectations: What are your long-term career goals, and how does this role align with them?

When you're ready, you can use this information to prepare a strong case for your desired salary range. Be confident and assertive during the negotiation, and don't be afraid to advocate for yourself.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Good luck with your research and negotiation!

(And don't forget to celebrate your accomplishments and the progress you've made so far. You got this!)
